Package de.tum.cit.ase.maze

Class MapLoader

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.ase.maze.MapLoader
public class MapLoader extends Object
The MapLoader class is responsible for loading and managing the map data for the MazeRunnerGame. It handles the layout of the game environment, including the placement of walls, obstacles, enemies, and other game elements. The class also manages dynamic elements like the display state of keys and hearts.

  • Constructor Details

    • MapLoader

      public MapLoader(MazeRunnerGame game, float sinusInput, String level)
      Constructs a MapLoader object for a specific level of the MazeRunnerGame. It initializes various game elements like walls, obstacles, enemies, and keys based on the level data.
      Parameters:
      game - The main game object associated with the map.
      sinusInput - A float value used for animations within the map.
      level - The file path or identifier for the level data to be loaded.

  • Method Details

    • setMaxXY

      public void setMaxXY(Map<List<Integer>,Integer> map)
      Determines and sets the maximum x and y coordinates for the map based on the provided map data.
      Parameters:
      map - A Map with keys as a list of two integers (coordinates) and values as integers (tile types).

    • setCoordinateLists

      public void setCoordinateLists()
      Processes the map data to populate lists of different game elements like walls, doors, and obstacles. It also sets the player's initial position and the position of the key on the map.

    • spaceCoordinate

      public void spaceCoordinate()
      Calculates and stores all possible coordinates for heart placements. This method ensures that hearts are not placed on walls or obstacles.

    • loadMapGeneral

      public void loadMapGeneral()
      Loads and renders any map layout. This method draws tiles, walls, doors, enemies, and other elements based on their coordinates. It also handles the animation and display state of dynamic elements like hearts.

    • loadMap5

      public void loadMap5()
      Loads and renders the fifth map layout. Similar to loadMapGeneral, it draws various elements like tiles, walls, doors, but with a different theme and layout. It also manages the animation and display of dynamic elements.

    • setSinusInput

      public void setSinusInput(float sinusInput)
      Sets the sinus input value, used for animations within the map.
      Parameters:
      sinusInput - The new sinus input value.

    • getMax_x

      public float getMax_x()
      Getter methods for various properties of the map. These include maximum dimensions, player's position, coordinates of different elements, and state of dynamic items. Each method returns the respective value or list of values.

    • getMax_y

      public float getMax_y()

    • getPlayer_x

      public float getPlayer_x()

      public int getHeartCoordinate2()

    • setDisplayKey

      public void setDisplayKey(boolean displayKey)
      Setter methods for controlling the display state of keys and hearts on the map.
      Parameters:
      displayKey - Boolean indicating whether the item (key/heart) should be displayed.
